[[Image:USB flash drive.jpg|thumb|right|A USB drive, shown with a mm ruler for scale.]]
+
[[Image:USB flash drive.jpg|thumb|right|A USB drive can carry portable applications]]
A '''portable application''', or '''portable app''' for short, is a [[computer]] [[software program]] that does not need to be [[software installation|installed]] or copied onto a computer's [[mass storage]] device to be executed, running instead from a removable storage device such as a [[CD-ROM]] drive, [[USB flash drive]], [[flash memory|flash card]], or [[floppy disk]]. Portable applications can be run on any computer system with which they are compatible; they usually require a certain type of [[operating system]] (e.g., [[Microsoft Windows]] XP or above, any Linux, etc). ''Portable software'' in this sense should not be confused with ''[[porting|software portability]]'', where software is designed in a way which allows its [[source code]] to be [[compiler|compiled]] for different [[computing platform]]s.
A '''portable application''', or '''portable app''' for short, is a [[computer]] [[software program]] that does not need to be [[software installation|installed]] or copied onto a computer's [[mass storage]] device to be executed, running instead from a removable storage device such as a [[CD-ROM]] drive, [[USB flash drive]], [[flash memory|flash card]], or [[floppy disk]]. Portable applications can be run on any computer system with which they are compatible; they usually require a certain type of [[operating system]] (e.g., [[Microsoft Windows]] XP or above, any Linux, etc). ''Portable software'' in this sense should not be confused with ''[[porting|software portability]]'', where software is designed in a way which allows its [[source code]] to be [[compiler|compiled]] for different [[computing platform]]s.
